name: action_chains
do:
• For chains of actions.
  • Also use when multiple steps are required.

name: activate_subscriptions
do: • For subscription activations.
dont: • To show activated subscriptions. Use product_subscriptions instead.

name: admin
do: • When a user or admin role needs to be distinguished in a list of users.

name: api
do: Use this icon to represent an API.
dont: Don't use it for an endpoint, there is an icon for this.

name: application
do: • To represent an application.

name: application_incomplete
do:
• When the status of an applications is incomplete.
  • When an application is missing configuration to work properly.
dont: • To represent an application or application instance.

name: application_instance
do: • To represent an instance of an aplication.
dont: • To represent an application or application status.

name: autoinstallation
do: • To represent an autoinstallation process.

name: background_tasks
do: • To indicate tasks that are running in the background.

name: bootstrapping
do: • When bootstraping a new element into a system.

name: cleanup
do: • To represent a cleanup process or action.

name: cloud_foundry_space
do: • To represent a Cloudfoundry space.

name: cluster_role
do:
• Indicates a cluster-scoped resources.
  • Indicates a non-resource endpoints.

name: cluster_role_binding
do: • Use it to represent a conexion of some type for a cluster role, for example, attaching permissions to the role

name: collocation
do: • For the action of placing or arranging tasks together.

name: config_map
do: • Use it for configuration map

name: configuration_file
do: • To represent a configuration file.
dont:
• To represent any other files or extensions.
  • To edit files. For this action use the edit icon from Material Design.

name: constraint
do: • To define constraints.

name: container
do: • use it for container

name: content_lifecycle_management
do: • To illustrate the planning cycle

name: counting
do: • To display countings of any type, e.g.: subscription counting, system counting, etc.

name: critical_bug
do: • To represent a critical bug fix or detection.

name: cronjob
do: • Use for job/script that will run as scheduled.

name: csv_file
do: • To represent a csv file.

name: daemon
do: • Use this icon to represent a computer program running in the background
dont: • Dont use it as a face or to request user feedback

name: daemon_set
do: • Use this icon to represent a group of processes running in the background
dont: • Don't use it to represent a library or comic

name: deploy
do:
• For deploying code/software to a server, container, etc.
    • >

name: endpoints
do: • To represent endpoints. E.g.: you have a table of information and you need to differentiate endpoint URIs.

name: endpoints_connected
do: • To represent a connection between two or more endpoints.

name: endpoints_disconnected
do: • To represent a disconnection between two or more endpoints.

name: enhancement
do:
• To represent an improvement.
  • To represent packages/patches that only deliver enhancements/improvements to the system.

name: file_system
do:
• To manage files on a server.
  • To control how data is stored and retrieved.

name: inbound
do: To illustrate inbound information or data

name: installing
do: • The user is waiting for an installation process to finalize.
dont: • As feedback for refreshing, reloading or syncing data.

name: job
do: • Use this icon for algorithm/script that is run to perform a certain action/job
dont: • Use it for flochart and logic scheme

name: kubelet
do: • Use it in features that take care of maintaining one or more PODs
dont: • Don't use it for configuration of PODs

name: loading
do: • The user is waiting for new content to be serverd.
dont: • The action returns invisible results for the user.

name: miscellaneous
do: • To indicate an additional set of features or actions that might not have been included in other sections.
dont: • To indicate elements that are unrelated to the application.

name: modified_date
do: • To represent a date that has been modified.
dont: • To represent any other type of editing that is not date.

name: molecules
do: Use it in atomic design to represent components.

name: move
do: • To represent the action of relocating elements.

name: multistate
do: • To show multiple states.

name: namespace
do: • Use it for namespaces or to specify a unique identifier among a group of elements
dont: • Don't use it for menu or options

name: network_file_system
do: • To access or share files across servers.

name: node
do:
• To represent a point in a network or diagram at which lines or pathways intersect or branch.
  • To represent devices or data points on a large network.

name: organization
do:
• To represent organizations.
  • Organizations are made of groups or teams, not individuals.

name: outbound
do: • To illustrate outbound information

name: package
do: • To represent a singular package.

name: package_upgrade
do: • To upgrade an existing package.

name: packages
do: • To represent a list of packages.

name: patterns
do: • To represent predictable behaivor

name: pin
do: • For actions that will let the user pin certain information to a list, table, or another type of accumulative data form.

name: pod
do: • To represent a group of containers.

name: pod_autoscaler
do: • Use it to replicate PODs automatically

name: pod_security
do: • Use to edit the security configuration of a pod, to view the security settings, or to enable/disable it.
dont: • Don't use it for general security settings

name: primitive
do:
• In atomic design, use it to represent atoms or elements
  • To perform the most basic task.

name: product_classes
do: • To represent product classes.

name: product_subscriptions
do: • To show a list of all subscriptions.

name: products
do: • To show a collection of products.

name: project
do: Use it to represent a project as in a set of tasks or actions to achieve a particular goal.
dont: Don't use it for upgrade or enhancement.

name: proxy
do: • To represent a proxy server or state.

name: ptf
do:
• To represent program temporary fixes.
  • To represent hotfixes.
  • For a special patch.

name: quota
do: • Use to describe the amount of space for a determined hard drive.

name: repositories
do: • To indicate product repositories.

name: role_binding
do: • Use it in features that grant special role permissions to a user or group of users
dont: • Don't use it for user account, admin, or similar

name: route
do: • To represent application routes.

name: sandbox
do: • For a special setting in software which uses dummy data to test APIs.

name: secure_data
do: • Use to store config info in a secure manner.

name: service
do: • To represent a service.

name: service_instance
do: • To represent service instance.

name: service_plan
do: • To represent a service or product plan, where plan is the detail of benefits the user subscribed/paid for.
dont:
• To represent service or service instance.
  • To represent a singular product.

name: smt
do: • To represent SMT/RMT servers with the SMT/RMT server information.

name: snapshot_rollback
do: • To rollback a snapshot, backup, or data saved, to a previous state.

name: software
do: • To represent software.
dont: • For software download. Use the material icon file_download instead.

name: state
do: • To represent states. Normally booleans true/false, on/off.

name: subscriptions_created
do: • To represent a successfully activated subscription.

name: symlink
do: • To represent a file that contains a reference to another file or directory.
dont: • To represent an external link, or links of any type other the one described above.

name: system_group
do: • To represent a group of systems.

name: system_image
do: • To represent disk images, containers or ISOs.
dont: • For images, such as photos or pictures.

name: system_re_registered
do: • To represent re-registered systems or the action of re-registering a system.

name: templates
do: Use it to represent a mockup or template of any type: configuration, web UI, etc.

name: terminal
do:
• Use this icon to let the user interact with the terminal from your application.
  • Use this icon to execute commands or to take the user to your command line interface.
dont: • Don't use it to represent code or code snippets.

name: timeout
do:
• When there is a server-side timeout.
  • When the time to performn an operation has passed.

name: troubleshooting
do: • To identify and resolve a problem.

name: trusted_organization
do: • To represent a trusted organization.

name: unpatched
do:
• To represent that the system is not updated.
  • To represent that the patch is not available for this system.

name: virtual_guest
do: • To represent a virtual machine.

name: virtual_host_manager
do: • To manage the virtual hosts on a server.

name: volume
do:
• Use it for unit of storage.
  • Use it for hard disk.

name: volume_binding
do: • Use it when connecting a volume to a system, container or others
dont: • Don't use it for general links or hyperlink to the volume page

name: workload
do: • To represent the amount of work to be done by someone or something.
